Interface NumberFormatOptions

@JsType(isNative=true, namespace="<global>") public interface NumberFormatOptions
Mapping for number format options passed to NumberFormat constructors.

In addition to the actual mappings, this class implements the builder pattern using enums to create the options easily and in a type-safe manner. Some enums are shared with other format option builders of the Intl module and may contain more values than intended for the given method. In that case the allowed values are listed on the method. In all other cases all enum values are applicable. 

double number = 123456.789;

console.log(numberFormat("de-DE", numberFormatOptions()
        .style(currency)
        .currency("EUR"))
        .format(number));
// Expected output: "123.456,79 €"

// The Japanese yen doesn't use a minor unit
console.log(numberFormat("ja-JP", numberFormatOptions()
        .style(currency)
        .currency("JPY"))
        .format(number));
// Expected output: "￥123,457"

// Limit to three significant digits
console.log(numberFormat("en-IN", numberFormatOptions()
        .maximumSignificantDigits(3))
        .format(number));
// Expected output: "1,23,000"
See Also:
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat#options

    • compactDisplay

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions compactDisplay(Format display)
      Allowed values: Format.short_, Format.long_.

    • currency

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions currency(String currency)
      The currency to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as "USD" for the US dollar, "EUR" for the euro, or "CNY" for the Chinese RMB — see Intl.supportedValuesOf(Category). There is no default value; if the style(Format) is Format.currency, the currency property must be provided. It is normalized to uppercase.

    • currencyDisplay

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions currencyDisplay(CurrencyDisplay currencyDisplay)
      Allowed values: CurrencyDisplay.code, CurrencyDisplay.symbol, CurrencyDisplay.narrowSymbol, Enum.name().

    • currencySign

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions currencySign(CurrencyDisplay currencyDisplay)
      Allowed values: CurrencyDisplay.standard, CurrencyDisplay.accounting.

    • localMatcher

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions localMatcher(Matcher localeMatcher)
      Allowed values: Matcher.lookup, Matcher.bestFit.

    • maximumFractionDigits

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions maximumFractionDigits(int digits)

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions notation(Notation notation)

    • numberingSystem

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions numberingSystem(NumberingSystem numberingSystem)
      The numbering system to use for number formatting, such as "arab", "hans", "mathsans", and so on. For a list of supported numbering system types, see Intl.supportedValuesOf(Category).

    • roundingIncrement

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions roundingIncrement(int increment)

    • roundingMode

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions roundingMode(Rounding mode)
      Allowed values: Rounding.ceil, Rounding.floor, Rounding.expand, Rounding.trunc, Rounding.halfCeil, Rounding.halfFloor, Rounding.halfExpand, Rounding.halfTrunc, Rounding.halfEven.

    • roundingPriority

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions roundingPriority(Rounding priority)
      Allowed values: Rounding.auto, Rounding.morePrecision.

    • signDisplay

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions signDisplay(When display)
      Allowed values: When.auto, When.always, When.exceptZero, When.negative, When.never.

    • style

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions style(Format style)
      Allowed values: Format.decimal, Format.currency, Format.percent, Format.unit.

    • trailingZeroDisplay

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions trailingZeroDisplay(When display)
      Allowed values: When.auto, When.stripIfInteger.

    • unit

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions unit(Unit unit)
      The unit to use in unit formatting, Possible values are listed in Intl.supportedValuesOf(Category). Pairs of simple units can be concatenated with "-per-" to make a compound unit. There is no default value; if the style(Format) is Format.unit, the unit property must be provided.

    • unit

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions unit(String unit)
      The unit to use in unit formatting, Possible values are listed in Intl.supportedValuesOf(Category). Pairs of simple units can be concatenated with "-per-" to make a compound unit. There is no default value; if the style(Format) is Format.unit, the unit property must be provided.

    • unitDisplay

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions unitDisplay(Format style)
      Allowed values: Format.short_, Format.narrow, Format.long_.

    • useGrouping

      @JsOverlay default NumberFormatOptions useGrouping(When grouping)
      Allowed values: When.always, When.auto, When.min2.
